captions.text:
- The spiciest thing I've ever
eaten is pepperjack cheese.
Spicy Food around the World, Taste Test
We used the FLIR thermal camera

to see if spicy foods
affect body temperature
- It just looks like a leg on a pancake.

- It's kind of smacking
the back of my tongue.
- It's burning my lips, I'm not gonna lie.
- It's got a little kick to it.
- It's kind of like a spicy barbecue.
- I could eat a whole plate of this.

- On a scale of one to
five, I'd give it a four.

Let's see how they look
in the thermal camera
The back of their tongues got hotter
- No, it's actually really spicy hot, too.
- It has a kick like a really good
- Since it's such a thick sauce,
it coats your mouth and just sits there.
- I think the more you eat of that,
the more you will be numb,
Her face and tongue got hotter
- It's like spicy, gross egg salad.

- This looks like
something a bad babysitter
- Oh, is that a potato in the egg?
- This is a purple Peruvian potato.
- It's like Velveeta on eggs and potatoes.
- I'm a fan of rice mixed with spice,
because it always seems to taste better.

- Rice and spice sounds
like a 90s R&B group.

- Girl, it's all rice, you're
not even touching the spice!
I don't really get any heat.
- I've had cereal spicier than this.
- One point five out of five.
Their foreheads and tongues got hotter
- This is some good old American spice.
- Who doesn't want their mouth on fire

- Oh!
- A little bit at the end.
- It's kind of getting to you.
- The joy of chicken wings is
you get to lick your fingers afterwards.
- Yeah, it makes my nose run,

They're just spicy
enough to keep you going.
Her tongue, neck, and eyes got warmer
- I'm a little worried about this one.

- This looks like a
ghost pepper's diarrhea.

- No, we don't know what
we're getting ourselves into.
- Oh, my whole mouth is spicy!

- It's like little tiny
fires all down my throat.
- Yeah, I'm feeling this in my ears.

- Yeah, I have tears
streaming down my face.
- You have a horror movie in your mouth?

I have a party in my mouth.
- He has a dance party.
- This isn't even five, this is like a 12.
Look at his eyes and her tongue!

- ♫ Do you like spicy
food more than anything?
♫ Then get yourself a wedding ring

title: Spicy Food Around The World Taste Test

comments.text:
I never thought spicy food made your mouth get literally hot.
I thought it just made it feel hot because of the chemical reactions 
happening, tongue/spice.
Edit___
And maybe something to do with the tastebuds/whatever receptors that are in 
your tongue.﻿

comments.text:
some of these buzzfeed videos are fine and fun. but the ones like this are 
quite rude, i must admit. it gives me the impression that americans think 
that the rest of the whole world is just america again. like there's no 
other country or culture -which is odd since america is multi cultured. i 
find it really ridiculous and disrespectful that they can just look at a 
plate and say 'omg so growse' or after a bite 'i can't even eat that 
anymore'. thats just a bit ignorant to me, of course not all americans 
aren't like this but still.. as a foreigner, i feel like if americans 
judged my culture (food in this case) so quickly like this, i would get 
extremely nationalist because all these foods are products of hundreds of 
years of hard work and culture, and lives of many. deserves a bit more 
respect than 'looks like diarrhoea' and  'kinda tastes like laundry' - 1:52 
excuse my english, i am turkish.﻿
